Package paoo.game.entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
paoo.game.entity.Entity
paoo.game.entity.Player
public class Player extends Entity
Represents the player character in the game. This class extends Entity and handles all player-specific functionality including movement, attacking, inventory management, object interaction, and rendering.

The player has a fixed screen position and moves around the world by changing their world coordinates. They can collect items, attack monsters, interact with NPCs, and progress through different game levels.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(GamePanel gamePanel, KeyHandler keyHandler)
      Constructs a new Player instance. Initializes the player's position, collision areas, and loads all sprites.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the main game panel containing game state and utilities
      keyHandler - the keyboard input handler for player controls

  • Method Details

    • isTeleportReady

      public boolean isTeleportReady()
      Gets the teleport ready status.
      Returns:
      true if player is ready to teleport, false otherwise

    • getSCREEN_X

      public int getSCREEN_X()
      Gets the player's fixed screen X coordinate.
      Returns:
      the X coordinate where player is drawn on screen

    • getSCREEN_Y

      public int getSCREEN_Y()
      Gets the player's fixed screen Y coordinate.
      Returns:
      the Y coordinate where player is drawn on screen

    • getNrCarrots

      public int getNrCarrots()
      Gets the number of carrots collected by the player.
      Returns:
      the current carrot count

    • getInventory

      public ArrayList<Entity> getInventory()
      Gets the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing all items in player's inventory

    • setAttackCanceled

      public void setAttackCanceled(boolean attackCanceled)
      Sets the attack canceled flag. Used to prevent attack animation when interacting with NPCs.
      Parameters:
      attackCanceled - true to cancel attack, false otherwise

    • setDefaultValues

      public void setDefaultValues()
      Sets the player's default starting values including position, speed, and health. Player starts at tile coordinates (45, 26) facing down with full health.

    • setDefaultPosition

      public void setDefaultPosition(int tileX, int tileY)
      Sets the player's position to specific tile coordinates.
      Parameters:
      tileX - the X tile coordinate to move to
      tileY - the Y tile coordinate to move to

    • setDefaultPositions

      public void setDefaultPositions()
      Sets the player's starting position based on the current game level. Each level has a different starting position: Level 1: (45, 26) Level 2: (30, 30) Level 3+: (44, 65)

    • setTeleportReady

      public void setTeleportReady(boolean teleportReady)
      Sets the teleport ready status.
      Parameters:
      teleportReady - true if player should be ready to teleport, false otherwise

    • restoreLife

      public void restoreLife()
      Restores the player's health to maximum and removes invincibility. Typically used when respawning or healing.

    • setItems

      public void setItems()
      Clears all items from the player's inventory. Used when starting a new game or resetting player state.

    • attacking

      public void attacking()
      Handles the player's attack animation and collision detection. Attack is disabled on level 1. The attack has multiple frames and can damage monsters within the attack area during specific frames.
      Overrides:
      attacking in class Entity

    • pickUpObject

      public void pickUpObject(int i)
      Handles interaction with objects in the game world. Different objects have different interaction behaviors: - Carrots: Can be harvested and collected - Chests/Portals/Caves: Require Enter key to interact
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the object to interact with, or -1 if no object

    • teleportToNextLevel

      public void teleportToNextLevel()
      Handles teleportation to the next game level. Plays teleport sound effect and advances to next level if not at maximum. Maximum level is 3.

    • searchItemInInventory

      public int searchItemInInventory(String itemName)
      Searches for a specific item in the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to search for
      Returns:
      the index of the item in inventory, or -1 if not found

    • canObtainItem

      public boolean canObtainItem(Entity item)
      Checks if the player can obtain a specific item. For stackable items, checks if item already exists in inventory. For all items, checks if there's available inventory space.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to check
      Returns:
      true if item can be obtained, false otherwise

    • addItemToInventory

      public void addItemToInventory(Entity item)
      Adds an item to the player's inventory. For stackable items, increments the amount if item already exists, otherwise adds as new item. For non-stackable items, adds directly if there's inventory space.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add to inventory

    • interactNpc

      public void interactNpc(int i)
      Handles interaction with NPCs. When Enter key is pressed near an NPC, starts dialog and changes game state.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the NPC to interact with, or -1 if no NPC

    • contactMonster

      public void contactMonster(int i)
      Handles contact with monsters (taking damage). If player is not invincible, reduces life by 1 and grants temporary invincibility.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the monster that contacted player, or -1 if no monster

    • damageMonster

      public void damageMonster(int i)
      Damages a monster during player attack. If monster is not invincible, reduces its life by 1 and grants it temporary invincibility. If monster's life reaches 0, removes it from the game.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the monster to damage, or -1 if no monster

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the player's state each game frame. Handles movement, collision detection, object interaction, NPC interaction, monster contact, attacking, sprite animation, invincibility timer, and death. This method is called once per game frame.
      Overrides:
      update in class Entity

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D graphics2D)
      Renders the player on screen with appropriate sprite and effects. Chooses the correct sprite based on movement state, direction, and animation frame. Applies transparency effect when player is invincible.
      Overrides:
      draw in class Entity
      Parameters:
      graphics2D - the Graphics2D context for rendering

    • getBufferedImage

      protected BufferedImage getBufferedImage(int frame, BufferedImage down1, BufferedImage down2, BufferedImage down3, BufferedImage down4, BufferedImage down5, BufferedImage down6)
      Helper method to get the appropriate sprite frame from a series of animation frames.
      Parameters:
      frame - the current animation frame number (1-6)
      down1 - animation frame 1
      down2 - animation frame 2
      down3 - animation frame 3
      down4 - animation frame 4
      down5 - animation frame 5
      down6 - animation frame 6
      Returns:
      the BufferedImage corresponding to the current frame

    • getPlayerImage

      public void getPlayerImage()
      Loads all player movement and idle animation sprites from image files. Loads 6 walking frames and 2 idle frames for each direction (up, down, left, right).

    • getPlayerAttackImage

      public void getPlayerAttackImage()
      Loads all player attack animation sprites from image files. Loads 4 attack frames for each direction (up, down, left, right).
